definition: to profit from sth/to get benefit

sentences.english: Of course, Beijing is often also able to exploit these seeming incongruities.
sentences.chinese: 當然，北京也時常能夠從這些不協調的情況中獲益。

sentences.english: This is a great good deed. The people involved can all benefit from it.
sentences.chinese: 這是件大好事，只要是參與的人都可以從中獲益。

sentences.english: And the Israeli neighbourhood would benefit, " says Bitan.
sentences.chinese: 以色列鄰居也會從巴勒斯坦的發展中獲益。

sentences.english: Much could be gained by creating an international network of websites committed to such principles.
sentences.chinese: 創建一個遵循這些原則的國際互聯網站獲益頗豐。

sentences.english: Japan benefits from those investments it makes in China in terms of corporate profits.
sentences.chinese: 從公司盈利的角度說，日本獲益於在華投資。

sentences.english: As a next-exporter of goods, China has benefited from a weak dollar.
sentences.chinese: 作爲加工出口導向的國家，中國從弱勢美元中獲益。

sentences.english: He says there was regular information-sharing between the mills and their suppliers that benefited both sides.
sentences.chinese: 他談到鋼鐵企業和供貨商經常信息共享，雙方獲益。

sentences.english: The first instructive experience took place while I was crossing the street.
sentences.chinese: 我經歷的第一件獲益的事發生在過街的時候。

sentences.english: Thus he may abridge his travel with much profit.
sentences.chinese: 這樣就能縮短旅遊的時間，而又獲益更多。

sentences.english: Streaming live video also benefits from a persistent connection.
sentences.chinese: 流式直播視頻也從持久連接中獲益良多。

sentences.english: Now I\'ve benefited a lot from lectures and many other academic reports.
sentences.chinese: 我從老師的授課和其他許多學術報告中獲益匪淺。

sentences.english: If the question benefits the playerbase, I will pick it.
sentences.chinese: 我會選擇讓玩家們獲益的問題。

sentences.english: Architects as well as assemblers who may be in lines of business can benefit from reading these articles.
sentences.chinese: 架構師以及業務線的組裝人員可以從這些文章中獲益。

sentences.english: Can enterprises benefit from social bookmarking and wikis?
sentences.chinese: 公司能從社會化書籤與維基中獲益嗎？

sentences.english: Jane has gained much from her failure.
sentences.chinese: 簡從她的失敗中獲益匪淺。

sentences.english: Michael has learned a lot over the past few months.
sentences.chinese: 邁可在過去這幾個月來獲益匪淺。

definition: to increase steadily/to grow with each passing day
railtrack connection/to integrate into sth/to dock/to connect/to be in step with/to bring into line with/to align
employee/person employed in a trade or profession
to take it up a notch/to bring it up a level
same trade or business/person in the same trade or business
